verses.verse: Now it happened<WH1961> at the end<WH7093> of two full<WH3117> years<WH8141> that Pharaoh<WH6547> had<WH2492> a dream,<WH2492> and behold,<WH2009> he was standing<WH5975> by the Nile.<WH2975>
And lo,<WH2009> from the Nile<WH2975> there came<WH5927> up seven<WH7651> cows,<WH6510> sleek<WH3303> and fat;<WH1277> and they grazed<WH7462> in the marsh<WH260> grass.<WH260>

Then behold,<WH2009> seven<WH7651> other<WH312> cows<WH6510> came<WH5927> up after<WH310> them from the Nile,<WH2975> ugly<WH7451> and gaunt,<WH1851> <WH1320> and they stood<WH5975> by the [other] cows<WH6510> on the bank<WH8193> of the Nile.<WH2975>
And the ugly<WH7451> and gaunt<WH1851> <WH1320> cows<WH6510> ate<WH398> up the seven<WH7651> sleek<WH3303> and fat<WH1277> cows.<WH6510> Then Pharaoh<WH6547> awoke.<WH3364>

And he fell<WH3462> asleep<WH3462> and dreamed<WH2492> a second<WH8145> time;<WH8145> and behold,<WH2009> seven<WH7651> ears<WH7641> of grain<WH7641> came<WH5927> up on a single<WH259> stalk,<WH7070> plump<WH1277> and good.<WH2896>
Then behold,<WH2009> seven<WH7651> ears,<WH7641> thin<WH1851> and scorched<WH7710> by the east<WH6921> wind,<WH6921> sprouted<WH6779> up after<WH310> them.
And the thin<WH1851> ears<WH7641> swallowed<WH1104> up the seven<WH7651> plump<WH1277> and full<WH4392> ears.<WH7641> Then Pharaoh<WH6547> awoke,<WH3364> and behold,<WH2009> [it was] a dream.<WH2472>

Now it came<WH1961> about in the morning<WH1242> that his spirit<WH7307> was troubled,<WH6470> so he sent<WH7971> and called<WH7121> for all<WH3605> the magicians<WH2748> of Egypt,<WH4714> and all<WH3605> its wise<WH2450> men.<WH2450> And Pharaoh<WH6547> told<WH5608> them his dreams,<WH2472> but there<WH369> was no<WH369> one<WH369> who could interpret<WH6622> them to Pharaoh.<WH6547>
Then the chief<WH8269> cupbearer<WH9307> spoke<WH1696> to Pharaoh,<WH6547> saying,<WH559> "I would make mention<WH2142> today<WH3117> of my [own] offenses.<WH2399>

"Pharaoh<WH6547> was furious<WH7107> with his servants,<WH5650> and he put<WH5414> me in confinement<WH4929> in the house<WH1004> of the captain<WH8269> of the bodyguard,<WH2876> [both] me and the chief<WH8269> baker.<WH644>
"And we had<WH2492> a dream<WH2472> on the same<WH259> night,<WH3915> he and I; each<WH376> of us dreamed<WH2492> according to the interpretation<WH6623> of his [own] dream.<WH2472>

"Now a Hebrew<WH5680> youth<WH5288> [was] with us there,<WH8033> a servant<WH5650> of the captain<WH8269> of the bodyguard,<WH2876> and we related<WH5608> [them] to him, and he interpreted<WH6622> our dreams<WH2472> for us. To each<WH376> one<WH376> he interpreted<WH6622> according to his [own] dream.<WH2472>
"And it came<WH1961> about that just<WH9201> as he interpreted<WH6622> for us, so<WH3651> it happened;<WH1961> he restored<WH7725> me in my office,<WH3653> but he hanged<WH8518> him."

Then Pharaoh<WH6547> sent<WH7971> and called<WH7121> for Joseph,<WH3130> and they hurriedly<WH7323> brought<WH7323> him out of the dungeon;<WH953> and when he had shaved<WH1548> himself and changed<WH2498> his clothes,<WH8071> he came<WH935> to Pharaoh.<WH6547>

And Pharaoh<WH6547> said<WH559> to Joseph,<WH3130> "I have had<WH2492> a dream,<WH2472> but no<WH369> one<WH369> can interpret<WH6622> it; and I have heard<WH8085> it said<WH559> about<WH5921> you, that when you hear<WH8085> a dream<WH2472> you can interpret<WH6622> it."
Joseph<WH3130> then answered<WH6030> Pharaoh,<WH6547> saying,<WH559> "It is not in me; God<WH430> will give<WH6030> Pharaoh<WH6547> a favorable<WH7965> answer.<WH6030>"
So Pharaoh<WH6547> spoke<WH1696> to Joseph,<WH3130> "In my dream,<WH2472> behold,<WH2009> I was standing<WH5975> on the bank<WH8193> of the Nile;<WH2975>
and behold,<WH2009> seven<WH7651> cows,<WH6510> fat<WH1277> and sleek<WH3303> came<WH5927> up out of the Nile;<WH2975> and they grazed<WH7462> in the marsh<WH260> grass.<WH260>

"And lo,<WH2009> seven<WH7651> other<WH312> cows<WH6510> came<WH5927> up after<WH310> them, poor<WH1800> and very<WH3966> ugly<WH7451> and gaunt,<WH7534> <WH1320> such<WH2007> as I had never<WH3808> seen<WH7200> for ugliness<WH7455> in all<WH3605> the land<WH776> of Egypt;<WH4714>
and the lean<WH7534> and ugly<WH7451> cows<WH6510> ate<WH398> up the first<WH7223> seven<WH7651> fat<WH1277> cows.<WH6510>

"Yet when they had devoured<WH935> <WH7130> them, it could not be detected<WH3045> that they had devoured<WH935> <WH7130> them; for they were just<WH9201> as ugly<WH7451> as before.<WH8462> Then I awoke.<WH3364>
"I saw<WH7200> also in my dream,<WH2472> and behold,<WH2009> seven<WH7651> ears,<WH7641> full<WH4392> and good,<WH2896> came<WH5927> up on a single<WH259> stalk;<WH7070>
and lo,<WH2009> seven<WH7651> ears,<WH7641> withered,<WH6798> thin,<WH1851> [and] scorched<WH7710> by the east<WH6921> wind,<WH6921> sprouted<WH6779> up after<WH310> them;

and the thin<WH1851> ears<WH7641> swallowed<WH1104> the seven<WH7651> good<WH2896> ears.<WH7641> Then I told<WH559> it to the magicians,<WH2748> but there<WH369> was no<WH369> one<WH369> who could explain<WH5046> it to me. "

Now Joseph<WH3130> said<WH559> to Pharaoh,<WH6547> "Pharaoh<WH6547>'s dreams<WH2472> are one<WH259> [and the same;] God<WH430> has told<WH5046> to Pharaoh what<WH853> <WH834> He is about to do.<WH6213>

"The seven<WH7651> good<WH2896> cows<WH6510> are seven<WH7651> years;<WH8141> and the seven<WH7651> good<WH2896> ears<WH7641> are seven<WH7651> years;<WH8141> the dreams<WH2472> are one<WH259> [and the same.]

"And the seven<WH7651> lean<WH7534> and ugly<WH7451> cows<WH6510> that came<WH5927> up after<WH310> them are seven<WH7651> years,<WH8141> and the seven<WH7651> thin<WH7534> ears<WH7641> scorched<WH7710> by the east<WH6921> wind<WH6921> shall be seven<WH7651> years<WH8141> of famine.<WH7458>
"It is as I have spoken<WH1696> to Pharaoh:<WH6547> God<WH430> has shown<WH7200> to Pharaoh<WH6547> what<WH834> He is about to do.<WH6213>
"Behold,<WH2009> seven<WH7651> years<WH8141> of great<WH1419> abundance<WH7647> are coming<WH935> in all<WH3605> the land<WH776> of Egypt;<WH4714>

and after<WH310> them seven<WH7651> years<WH8141> of famine<WH7458> will come,<WH6965> and all<WH3605> the abundance<WH7647> will be forgotten<WH7911> in the land<WH776> of Egypt;<WH4714> and the famine<WH7458> will ravage<WH3615> the land.<WH776>
"So the abundance<WH7647> will be unknown<WH3045> <WH3808> in the land<WH776> because<WH4480> <WH6440> of that subsequent<WH310> famine;<WH7458> for it [will be] very<WH3966> severe.<WH3515>

"Now as for the repeating<WH8138> of the dream<WH2472> to Pharaoh<WH6547> twice,<WH6471> [it means] that the matter<WH1697> is determined<WH3559> by God,<WH430> and God<WH430> will quickly<WH4116> bring<WH6213> it about.<WH6213>
"And now<WH6258> let Pharaoh<WH6547> look<WH7200> for a man<WH376> discerning<WH995> and wise,<WH2450> and set<WH7896> him over<WH5921> the land<WH776> of Egypt.<WH4714>

"Let Pharaoh<WH6547> take<WH6213> action<WH6213> to appoint<WH6485> overseers<WH6496> in charge<WH5921> of the land,<WH776> and let him exact<WH2567> a fifth<WH2567> [of the produce] of the land<WH776> of Egypt<WH4714> in the seven<WH7651> years<WH8141> of abundance.<WH7647>

"Then let them gather<WH6908> all<WH3605> the food<WH3978> of these<WH428> good<WH2896> years<WH8141> that are coming,<WH935> and store<WH6651> up the grain<WH1250> for food<WH400> in the cities<WH5892> under<WH8478> Pharaoh's authority,<WH3027> and let them guard<WH8104> [it.]

"And let the food<WH400> become<WH1961> as a reserve<WH6487> for the land<WH776> for the seven<WH7651> years<WH8141> of famine<WH7458> which<WH834> will occur<WH1961> in the land<WH776> of Egypt,<WH4714> so that the land<WH776> may not perish<WH3772> during the famine.<WH7458>"
Now the proposal<WH1697> seemed<WH3190> good<WH3190> to Pharaoh<WH6547> and to all<WH3605> his servants.<WH5650>
Then Pharaoh<WH6547> said<WH559> to his servants,<WH5650> "Can we find<WH4672> a man<WH376> like this,<WH2088> in whom<WH834> is a divine<WH430> spirit<WH7307>?"

So Pharaoh<WH6547> said<WH559> to Joseph,<WH3130> "Since<WH310> God<WH430> has informed<WH3045> you of all<WH3605> this,<WH2088> there<WH369> is no<WH369> one<WH369> so discerning<WH995> and wise<WH2450> as you are.

"You shall be over<WH5921> my house,<WH1004> and according<WH5921> to your command<WH6310> all<WH3605> my people<WH5971> shall do<WH5401> homage;<WH5401> only<WH7534> in the throne<WH3678> I will be greater<WH1431> than<WH4480> you."
And Pharaoh<WH6547> said<WH559> to Joseph,<WH3130> "See<WH7200> I have set<WH5414> you over<WH5921> all<WH3605> the land<WH776> of Egypt.<WH4714>"

Then Pharaoh<WH6547> took<WH5493> off<WH5493> his signet<WH2885> ring<WH2885> from his hand,<WH3027> and put<WH5414> it on Joseph's hand,<WH3027> and clothed<WH3847> him in garments<WH899> of fine<WH8336> linen,<WH8336> and put<WH7760> the gold<WH2091> necklace<WH7242> around<WH5921> his neck.<WH6677>

And he had him ride<WH7392> in his second<WH4932> chariot;<WH4818> and they proclaimed<WH7121> before<WH6440> him, "Bow<WH86> the knee!<WH86>" And he set<WH5414> him over<WH5921> all<WH3605> the land<WH776> of Egypt.<WH4714>

Moreover, Pharaoh<WH6547> said<WH559> to Joseph,<WH3130> "[Though] I am Pharaoh,<WH6547> yet without<WH1107> your permission no<WH3808> one<WH376> shall raise<WH7311> his hand<WH3027> or foot<WH7272> in all<WH3605> the land<WH776> of Egypt.<WH4714>"

Then Pharaoh<WH6547> named<WH7121> <WH8034> Joseph<WH3130> Zaphenath-paneah; and he gave<WH5414> him Asenath,<WH621> the daughter<WH1323> of Potiphera<WH6319> priest<WH3548> of On,<WH204> as his wife.<WH802> And Joseph<WH3130> went<WH3318> forth<WH3318> over<WH5921> the land<WH776> of Egypt.<WH4714>

Now Joseph<WH3130> was thirty<WH7970> years<WH8141> old<WH1121> when he stood<WH5975> before<WH6440> Pharaoh,<WH6547> king<WH4428> of Egypt.<WH4714> And Joseph<WH3130> went<WH3318> out from the presence<WH6440> of Pharaoh,<WH6547> and went<WH5674> through<WH5674> all<WH3605> the land<WH776> of Egypt.<WH4714>
And during the seven<WH7651> years<WH8141> of plenty<WH7647> the land<WH776> brought<WH6213> forth<WH6213> abundantly.<WH7062>

So he gathered<WH6908> all<WH3605> the food<WH400> of [these] seven<WH7651> years<WH8141> which<WH834> occurred<WH1961> in the land<WH776> of Egypt,<WH4714> and placed<WH5414> the food<WH400> in the cities;<WH5892> he placed<WH5414> in every city<WH5892> the food<WH400> from its own surrounding<WH5439> fields.<WH7704>

Thus Joseph<WH3130> stored<WH6651> up grain<WH1250> in great<WH3966> abundance<WH3966> like the sand<WH2344> of the sea,<WH3220> until<WH5704> <WH3588> he stopped<WH2308> measuring<WH5608> [it,] for it was beyond<WH369> measure.<WH4557>

Now before<WH2962> the year<WH8141> of famine<WH7458> came,<WH935> two<WH8147> sons<WH1121> were born<WH3205> to Joseph,<WH3130> whom<WH834> Asenath,<WH621> the daughter<WH1323> of Potiphera<WH6319> priest<WH3548> of On,<WH204> bore<WH3205> to him.

And Joseph<WH3130> named<WH7121> <WH8034> the first-born Manasseh,<WH4519> "For," [he said,] "God<WH430> has made me forget<WH5382> all<WH3605> my trouble<WH5999> and all<WH3605> my father's household.<WH1004>"
And he named<WH7121> <WH8034> the second<WH8145> Ephraim,<WH669> "For," [he said,] "God<WH430> has made<WH6509> me fruitful<WH6509> in the land<WH776> of my affliction.<WH6040>"
When the seven<WH7651> years<WH8141> of plenty<WH7647> which<WH834> had been<WH1961> in the land<WH776> of Egypt<WH4714> came<WH3615> to an end,<WH3615>

and the seven<WH7651> years<WH8141> of famine<WH7458> began<WH2490> to come,<WH935> just<WH9201> as Joseph<WH3130> had said,<WH559> then there was famine<WH7458> in all<WH3605> the lands;<WH776> but in all<WH3605> the land<WH776> of Egypt<WH4714> there was bread.<WH3899>

So when all<WH3605> the land<WH776> of Egypt<WH4714> was famished,<WH7456> the people<WH5971> cried<WH6817> out to Pharaoh<WH6547> for bread;<WH3899> and Pharaoh<WH6547> said<WH559> to all<WH3605> the Egyptians,<WH4714> "Go<WH1980> to Joseph;<WH3130> whatever<WH834> he says<WH559> to you, you shall do.<WH6213>"

When the famine<WH7458> was [spread] over<WH5921> all<WH3605> the face<WH6440> of the earth,<WH776> then Joseph<WH3130> opened<WH6605> all<WH3605> the storehouses,<WH834> and sold<WH7666> to the Egyptians;<WH4714> and the famine<WH7458> was severe<WH2388> in the land<WH776> of Egypt.<WH4714>

And [the people of] all<WH3605> the earth<WH776> came<WH935> to Egypt<WH4714> to buy<WH7666> grain<WH7666> from Joseph,<WH3130> because<WH3588> the famine<WH7458> was severe<WH2388> in all<WH3605> the earth.<WH776>
